description:
Yuri Orshulevich, Senior NLP Engineer at SuperAnnotate, provides a talk on "LLM-Generated Text Detection." 

In the evolving AI and NLP landscape, the rise of Large Language Models (LLMs) has led to a new era of text generation. Identifying machine-generated content presents a significant challenge with the growing complexity of these models.

The talk emphasizes the importance of distinguishing machine-generated vs human-written text by exploring possible problems and ways to avoid them. 

During the talk, you will:
-Explore the significance of text detection in various domains and ongoing efforts, including competitions. 
-Evaluate the current progress in this area, highlighting the apparent simplicity of a task, which in reality is complex. 
-Examine existing open-source solutions, their limitations, and areas for improvement.
-Be introduced to a high-quality benchmark that provides a clear way to measure performance.

Slides: https://shorturl.at/fhmpv

GitHub repo: https://github.com/superannotateai/generated_text_detector

HuggingFace model: https://huggingface.co/SuperAnnotate/roberta-large-llm-content-detector
